page.description: Fires when the user presses a key that produces a character value while the control has focus.

description.p: An object that contains properties and methods for inspecting and manipulating the browser event. This object can be referenced in JavaScript added to the event, either through Action Javascript or using *[ui:Text Mode]*.

discussion.p: The *[ui:onKeyPress]* event fires when the user presses a key on the keyboard that produces a character value, such as a letter, number, or punctuation. Keys that do not produce a character, such as shift and alt, will not trigger the *[ui:onKeyPress]* event.
The event fires after the [onKeyDown] event. You can add Action Javascript, custom JavaScript, or sever-side Xbasic to execute one or more actions to this event.

For more information about keyboard events, see *[extlink:Mozilla's documentation on KeyboardEvents@https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent]* or the developer documentation for your favorite web browser.
